text:
when working on logging traffic stats for on a mod_dav site I found that when
writing a file the log did not tell me the right size request.

This is what I send to Apache HTTPD:
PUT /km2/SMBdldr.tgz HTTP/1.1

Connection: Keep-Alive

User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Konqueror/3.5; Linux) KHTML/3.5.0 (like Gecko)

Pragma: no-cache

Cache-control: no-cache

Accept: text/html, image/jpeg, image/png, text/*, image/*, */*

Accept-Encoding: x-gzip, x-deflate, gzip, deflate

Accept-Charset: utf-8, utf-8;q=0.5, *;q=0.5

Accept-Language: en

Host: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX:8080

Authorization: Basic ZGVyazpkZXJrZGVyaw==

Content-Length: 13629



<binairy data>

And this is the logline I found in the apachelogs for this request:
XX.XX.XX.XX - name [30/Nov/2005:23:25:36 +0100] "PUT /km2/SMBdldr.tgz HTTP/1.1"
201 278 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Konqueror/3.5; Linux) KHTML/3.5.0 (like
Gecko)"
creator: derk@gortemaker.nl
rpluem@apache.org
text:
Actually it is correct as the standard access log only shows the amount of data
the web server SENT (response data), not the amount of data the webserver
RECEIVED (request data). Please have a look at %...I at
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/mod/mod_log_config.html#formats and at
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/mod/mod_logio.html for logging the size of the
request data.
